moves.1. f4:
Bird opening, nothing says it's not a good opening (well, ok a bit less than 1.e4 but a good opening).
Danielsen plays 1.f4
moves.1... c5:
A good answer. For example, it's difficult for White to build a stonewall.

With 1...c5, it's more a close opening.
If Black prefers attack 1....e5 is powerful (gambit From) and Black takes the hand.
moves.2... Nc6 3. g3:
To stay in Bird opening (avoid Sicilian or Pirc for example).
Polar bear system.
moves.3... Nf6 4. Bg2: Standard move in polar bear system.
moves.6. fxe5: And not the good answer (d3 is good with the idea to take with the bishop).
moves.10... Nxe4 11. Ne5: Ask a question to f7 (with a fork chess/rook) and to Ke4
moves.12. Bxe4 f5: Often hazardous to open the pawn f
moves.15... Rad8: In this place a fork king / rook is possible
moves.16. c3: Try to have the place for Kc6  and a fork
moves.16... Nd5 17. Nc6+ Kd7 18. Nxd8 Kxd8: The black king can be chess by the  white rook (and lost a piece in the d column), better to take with the rook
moves.20... Ke7 21. Rxd5 g6 22. Rfd1 Rb8 23. R: To avoid the king escape in f5
